About me

I'm a Canadian teacher with over 5 years of international teaching experience. I currently teach nearly 30 students online per week. My current students are from many different countries like Vietnam, Colombia, Ecuador and Costa Rica. I teach English, Math, Science and Social Studies. My teaching experience has been with two reputable curriculums: The Cambridge Curriculum and The Global Ivy Curriculum. I studied Geophysics at the University of Calgary, Canada so I have a very strong background in physics and math. I'm also fluent in Spanish as I'm half Uruguayan. Aside from teaching I develop software. I built this website by myself and have built several other websites, apps and games using the most up to date developer tools. I feel great satisfaction knowing I'm helping others to achieve their goals. Some of my other interests include travelling, fitness, photography and geography.

What I offer

I'm very excited to be offering 2 different courses based on my areas of expertise:


    Traditional English classes for beginners and lower-intermediate students.
  • - Build English speaking, grammar, vocabulary, pronunciation, reading, listening and writing skills.
  • - Lessons uniquely planned for each student, curriculum content influenced by experience using Cambridge and Ivy Global programs.
  • - Create and present a diverse range of projects on interesting topics like holidays, technology and traditions.
      • - Conversational classes for intermediate to advanced students.
    This class is designed for students who already have a good base of English and simply want to practice having conversations with a native speaker. I have hundreds of topics that I have experience teaching in conversational classes. This is a great way to learn advanced vocabulary and to practice having a natural conversation at nearly normal speed English. If you feel confident in your English grammar, pronunciation and speaking this course could be for you!
